yahtzee

Class YInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • yahtzee.YInterface

  • public class YInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    The YIterface class controls/displays the game UI and information. It handles all user interaction/commands and maps them to their corresponding game logic function. Only modifies the YLogic (game logic) class when necessary occording to player commands or the flow of the game. Most functions however deal with displaying information to the screen for the user to see. Commands are hard- coded into the class as well as file names that are used for displaying certain pages related to the game. All methods that directly or indirectly mutate the YLogic class, flow of the game, or is a helper function will be private in order to prevent outside-class use. All public functions will only facilitate/inspect YLogic class elements with the exception of the playerPrompt method which starts the game.

    • Method Detail

      • playerPrompt

        public void playerPrompt(YLogic gLog)
        Handles all user input commands and maps them to their corresponding functions. Prompt will continue until program termination (quit).
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • availableCategories

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> availableCategories(YLogic gLog,
                                                            boolean b)
        Compiles a list of categories available to user at the moment of this method call. All categories that were picked already will be x'd out.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object
        b - True to add the table headers. False to not print.
        Returns:
        List of Strings which holds all available categories

      • playerStats

        public void playerStats(YLogic gLog)
        Shows the current statistics of the user's current round. Will show the current round number, number of rolls rolled, current dice rolled, current kept dice if applicable and previous rolls rolled this round including the current roll.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • gameStats

        public void gameStats(YLogic gLog)
        Shows the current statistics of the user's current game. Will show the current total of rolls rolled, Yahtzee count, raw score, bonus score, total score, and individual round information if applicable. Round information includes the score of the round, the category picked and every roll rolled for that round. At least on round must be completed before round information will be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • checkYahtzee

        public void checkYahtzee(YLogic gLog)
        Prints whether the current roll is a Yahtzee i.e. all dice the same
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • printScoreSheet

        public void printScoreSheet(YLogic gLog)
        Gets the blank scoresheet file from the file parser method and then adds the player's scores dynamically occording to the the category. Normal categories are depicted as parentheses, bonus categories are depicted as curly braces and total categories are depcited as brackets. A special category for the Yahtzee bonus count uses the lt gt signs. Will only show the scores of categories picked, bonuses and totals.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • printIntroTag

        public void printIntroTag()
        Method to print an intro tag to welcome the user to the game and inform them of basic game information or anything else helpful.

      • printRoll

        public void printRoll(YLogic gLog)
        Prints the current roll in both dice format and number format. Also displays the current round and roll number. Will also determine if the roll is a Yahtzee or not.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • printKeptDice

        public void printKeptDice(YLogic gLog)
        Prints the dice the user has decided to keep to the screen.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • printDice

        public void printDice(YLogic gLog)
        Prints the dice object by converting it to a string
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • printDiceImage

        public void printDiceImage(YLogic gLog)
        Prints the dice object as an image
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • diceToImage

        public java.lang.String diceToImage(YLogic gLog)
        Creates a visible image to the likeness of a dice face. Each dice face will correspond to each number in the roll. Calls a helper function to figure what section of the dice face to print according to what level of the print the method is on. Dice faces are printed horizontally.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object
        Returns:
        The string containing the dice face images
        See Also:
        imagerHelper(int, int)

      • beginGame

        private YLogic beginGame(YLogic gLog)
        Begins the game by setting the roll, total rolls, and round number to one as well as printing the first roll and setting the game in progress boolean to true. If this function is called during a game in progress. The user will be warned that game is about to be restarted. If the user wishes to continue an new game will be started, if not the game function will return and the game will proceed as normal.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object
        Returns:
        The new instance of the game logic object.

      • quitGame

        private void quitGame()
        Prompts the user if they really wish to quit the game. If the user picks yes the program will terminate. If no is picked, the game will continue.

      • pickCategory

        private boolean pickCategory(YLogic gLog)
        Allows the user to pick a category from the currently available categories. Choosing a category will end the round and continue to the next round. The user may exit from making a choice by entering zero unless it is currently the last roll of the round.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object
        Returns:
        True if a category was picked. False if one was not picked.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - User entered non-numeric input

      • checkEndRound

        private void checkEndRound(YLogic gLog)
        Checks if the game has reached the end of the round i.e. by meeting or exceeding the number of alloted rolls. Also checks if the game is over i.e. by meeting or exceeding the number of alloted rounds.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • roll

        private void roll(YLogic gLog)
        Rolls the player's dice. If the user has not recently picked dice to keep this method will warn them with a prompt on whether they wish to return and pick dice to keep or continue with the roll anyway
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • keepDice

        private void keepDice(YLogic gLog)
        Method that allows the user decide what dice they would like to keep. The user will be asked for each die if they want to keep it or not. After successfully deciding what dice to keep, the kept dice will be printed.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • cheat

        private void cheat(YLogic gLog)
        Allows the player to 'cheat' by selecting whatever dice they want for their roll. The use of this function should be used exclusively for bug- testing or score-testing. Using this function does not modify round data so data may be inconsistent if the user cheats.
        Parameters:
        gLog - YLogic (game logic) object

      • imagerHelper

        private int imagerHelper(int num,
                         int pos)
        Helps the diceToImage method by returning a key to get the correct portion of the dice face to print according to the number given and the section number.
        Parameters:
        num - The dice number
        pos - The section position number
        Returns:
        The key which is used to access the correct String in a String map

      • yesNoPrompt

        private boolean yesNoPrompt(java.lang.String str)
        Prompts the user with a yes or no question. Changes the input to lower case for maximum compatibility.
        Parameters:
        str - String for the prompt to print (Should be a yes/no question)
        Returns:
        true if the user entered y (yes) False if the user entered n (no).

      • parseFile

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> parseFile(java.io.File file)
        Parses a file and splits it into token Strings by line. The strings are added to a list of Strings and returned once the whole file is parsed.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to parse
        Returns:
        The list that contains the String tokens

      • printList

        private void printList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
        Prints a given list of Strings. Mostly used for printing parsed files.
        Parameters:
        list - List to print to screen (most likely parsed file)

      • printNumberedList

        private void printNumberedList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
        Prints a list of strings but numbers them according to their order in the list. Each entry is separated by a new-line.
        Parameters:
        list - List used to print a numbered list

      • insRep

        private void insRep(java.util.List<java.lang.String> l,
                    java.lang.String tot,
                    java.lang.String r,
                    int idx,
                    int i)
        Inserts a given String into an exact position of another String. It will then take that String and place it in a list of Strings at a given index. Uses a StringBuilder to handle the String insertion.
        Parameters:
        l - The list of Strings to place the new String inside of
        tot - The String to edit
        r - The String to insert into tot
        idx - The position in String tot to place String r
        i - The position in l to swap for the newly build String

      • prgErr

        private boolean prgErr(boolean b,
                       java.lang.String str)
        If the game is not in progress this will print an error message to screen.
        Parameters:
        b - Boolean that tells if the game is in progress or not
        str - String to add to the "Game not in progress." error message
        Returns:
        gPrg: in order be able to place this function in an if statement
